Literature.Title: Human beta-defensin 4: a novel inducible peptide with a specific salt-sensitive spectrum of antimicrobial activity.
Literature.Author: García JR, Krause A, Schulz S, Rodríguez-Jiménez FJ, Klüver E, Adermann K, Forssmann U, Frimpong-Boateng A, Bals R, Forssmann WG

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial activity of human ?-defensin 4 analogs: insights into the role of disulfide linkages in modulating activity.
Literature.Author: Sharma H, Nagaraj R

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus carnosus TM300(MIC=4.5µg/ml),Staphylococcus carnosus TM300(MIC=>72µg/ml),Escherichia coli BL21(MIC=>100µg/ml),Saccharomyces cerevisiae ATCC 9763(MIC=>100µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1(MIC=4.1µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=>100µg/ml),Streptococcus pneumoniae ATCC 33400(MIC=>100µg/ml),Burkholderia cepacia ATCC 17770(MIC=>100µg/ml),Escherichia coli MG1655(LC=5µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa NCTC 6750(LC=12µM),Staphylococcus aureus NCTC 8530(LC=12µM),Candida albicans ATCC 18804(MFC=7.5µM)
